content: A few points. 1) Never question anyones decorations, awards, citations etc without damned good cause and evidence. 2) Never dig into someones file for any reason other than authorized reasons. 3) If you think a fellow military member is full of BS, there are easy ways to find out, most units have a few guys that have been there and done that for the last twenty or thirty years, so finding someone that was there for the last three is not hard. Get on of the old timers to talk with the guy and he'll be able to tell you if the guy is blowing smoke or not 99% of the time. 4) Three year PFC? Possible, start as low man on the totem pole, and advance only well after the minimums for time in grade. Or get busted down from a higher grade, lose a stripe from changing specialties, rerating, or sometimes for changing branches of service(not common but I know two guys that went through it). 5) If you want to make it a formal matter, your six better be covered well enough to stop a nuclear salvo, they take charges like this seriously. “If you bring these leaders to trial, it will condemn the North, for by the Constitution, secession is not rebellion...His (Jeff Davis') capture was a mistake. His trial will be a greater one. We cannot convict him of treason." Chief Justice Salmon P. Chase, 1867.
